_header: In name of him All-wielding / That is our high heaven king
_description: A translation of Part I of St. Edmund’s Speculum

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
IN nome of him al weldyngÞat is vr heiȝe heuene
                    kyng…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And þei ben pore in querteþat han riches and louen
                    pouerte
BodEngPoeta1.Note: Hou a man schal lyue parfytly (f. 227vc)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS
         o.s. 98 (1892; repr. 1973): 221-51.

IN nome of hym alweldyngþat is vur heiȝe heuene
